title: Potential compiler error (rustc 1.65.0 (897e37553 2022-11-02)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Hello,

I wanted to test AVX512 instruction set via inline assembly and encountered compiler error.

#### Details:
##### Program: 
```rs
use std::arch::asm;

fn main() {
    unsafe {
        asm!(
            "vfmadd132ps {a},{b},{c} ",
            a = out(zmm_reg) _,
            b = out(zmm_reg) _,
            c = out(zmm_reg) _,
        );
    }
}
```

##### Error log: 
[rust_compiler_error.txt](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/files/10174902/rust_compiler_error.txt)

##### Other:
- My cpu is capable of using  AVX512. 
[lscpu.txt](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/files/10174913/lscpu.txt)
- OS I'm running is Linux Fedora release 36 (Thirty Six)

As this is my first post here, I would like to say thank you for you wonderful work on rust. Feel free to ask me for more details if needed.
